fn plus_one(x: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> {
    match x {
        None => None,
        Some(i) => Some(i + 1),
    }
}

let five = Some(5);
let six = plus_one(five);
let none = plus_one(None);

entry.title: Markdown & Extended
entry.summary: This is a post showing all supported elements.
entry.content:
This is a post showing all supported elements.

As you can see in this post.

  • Third item

ordered:

  1. First item

    1. Indented item

    2. Indented item

  2. Second item

  3. Third item

Link#

There is a link and another link to example.com

Table#

ParagraphTextAnd more

with alignment:

SyntaxDescriptionTest Text
HeaderTitleHere's this
ParagraphTextAnd more

Footnote#

Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet1 words consectetur2 adipisicing elit.

Strikethrough#

The world is flat. We now know that the world is round.

Horizontal Rule#

Image#

with caption:

with a 'via' attribution:

Code#

inline code and more inline code

block level code:

fn plus_one(x: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> {
    match x {
        None => None,
        Some(i) => Some(i + 1),
    }
}

let five = Some(5);
let six = plus_one(five);
let none = plus_one(None);

with line number:

1fn plus_one(x: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> {

2    match x {

3        None => None,

4        Some(i) => Some(i + 1),

5    }

6}

7

97    }

98}

fn plus_one(x: Option<i32>) -> Option<i32> {
    match x {
        None => None,
        Some(i) => Some(i + 1),
    }
}

let five = Some(5);
let six = plus_one(five);
let none = plus_one(None);

wiht header:

Note

Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Praesentium, nisi saepe dolor unde iusto dolore nam, vero optio consequuntur repudiandae et! Atque libero expedita laudantium cupiditate, sit explicabo sequi ipsa!

BREAKING!

Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

Math (KaTex)#

$$ f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infin \hat f(\xi) e^{2 \pi i \xi x}\ d\xi $$

When $ a \ne 0 $, there are two solutions to $ (ax^2 + bx + c = 0) $ and they are $$ x = {-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac} \over 2a} $$

The Cauchy-Schwarz Inequality

$$\left( \sum_{k=1}^n a_k b_k \right)^2 \leq \left( \sum_{k=1}^n a_k^2 \right) \left( \sum_{k=1}^n b_k^2 \right)$$

Chart (Mermaid)#

  sequenceDiagram
    Alice ->> Bob: Hello Bob, how are you?
    Bob-->>John: How about you John?
    Bob--x Alice: I am good thanks!
    Bob-x John: I am good thanks!
    Note right of John: Bob thinks a long<br/>long time, so long<br/>that the text does<br/>not fit on a row.

    Bob-->Alice: Checking with John...
    Alice->John: Yes... John, how are you?

Comment (Giscus)#

As you can see in this post.
